thread.title: 23 Ways To Trick People Into Thinking You Hired An Interior Decorator
thread.title_full: 23 Ways To Trick People Into Thinking You Hired An Interior Decorator

author: Elizabeth Lilly
title: 23 Ways To Trick People Into Thinking You Hired An Interior Decorator
text:
View this image ›
Zoë Burnett / BuzzFeed We hope you love the products we recommend! Just so you know, BuzzFeed may collect a share of sales from the links on this page.
ID: 10321818 1. Liven up a neutral palette with throw pillows that boast lots of bells and whistles, like these pretty Nate Berkus ones. View this image ›
target.com Get them from Target for $7.48 and $12.48 .
ID: 10313041 2. Embrace an atypical ceiling by painting it — and the walls — a bold hue. View this image ›
homepolish.com See the full Hollywood Hills home tour on Homepolish here .
ID: 10308308 3. Incorporate a bright end table in turquoise or red for a memorable decor scheme. Get them from AllModern: $48 and $59.99 (available in five other colors). anthropologie.com , allmodern.com Get them from AllModern: $48 and $59.99 (available in five other colors).
ID: 10308257 4. Make a mismatched sofa and chairs work by sticking to the same fabric and style. Go bold with the colors! View this image ›
domino.com Check out Domino’s guide on buying a couch here .
Get a similar green-velvet sofa from West Elm for $699+ and a fuchsia velvet chair from World Market for $229.99 .
ID: 10308047 5. Fall for a printed love seat or sofa and build off of it as a focal point. View this image ›
target.com Get it from Target for $599.99 . / Available in six patterns and nine solid colors.
ID: 10313342 6. Put bathroom lighting on the sides of your mirror instead of above it for a significantly more flattering glow. View this image ›
amazon.com Get a sconce for $39.99 each. / Available in polished chrome (shown), brushed nickel, and bronze.
ID: 10301143 7. Think UP when it comes to mantel art for an interesting vignette and bigger-feeling space. View this image ›
thegatheredhome.com Learn how to make this vintage-style wall art on The Gathered Home here .
Get a similar balloon patent print from art print beauty on Etsy for $5+ . / Available in four sizes.
ID: 10308749 8. Make an easy gallery wall look pulled together by putting all your random art into coordinating frames . View this image ›
homepolish.com Get more deets on this National Geographic -inspired color scheme on Homepolish here and a guide on how to make the perfect gallery wall here .
Get a set of 10 picture frames from Amazon for $35.04+ . / Available in four colors.
ID: 10301140 9. Or, fill up a wall with a BIG piece of art that takes up 2/3rds of your wall space. View this image ›
urbanoutfitters.com Bringing new meaning to “Wide Open Spaces.”
Get it from Urban Outfitters for $19+ . / Available in four sizes. (Largest size shown.)
ID: 10307940 10. Choose wisely when it comes to wood finishes on furniture. Teak, oak, walnut, rosewood, and natural cherry look pricey. View this image ›
designlovefest.com Avoid any stuff that looks too shiny or unnatural. This dining set hits the mark with a deep wood finish that doesn’t look cheap. Check out the rest of Bri’s home tour on designlovefest here .
ID: 10307941 11. Find the right paint paint shade for your project with this tiny color-matching tool . View this image ›
amazon.com Scan a color and get exact matches on your device for leading paint brands like Benjamin Moore, Valspar, Sherwin-Williams, Kelly Moore, PPG, and more.
Get it from Amazon for $49 .
ID: 10314423 12. Hang curtains at just the right height, aka somewhere around 6” to 12” above the window frame. View this image ›
Chris Patey for MyDomaine / Via mydomaine.com Check out MyDomaine’s must-know decorating rules here .
Get an adjustable 48” to 86” curtain rod from Amazon for $12.99 and a blue curtain panel from Bed, Bath & Beyond for $9.99 .
ID: 10307943 13. Have at least three “layers” of lighting in every room, like overhead , task lighting , mood lighting , etc. amazon.com , amazon.com , amazon.com Get them from Amazon: Glass ceiling light for $59.99 , brass three-light floor lamp for $49.95 , and can mini accent light for $11.99 .
ID: 10301141 14. Leave at least 12” between furniture pieces for people to walk — which is doable in even this studio apartment . View this image ›
Melissa Oholendt for The Everygirl / Via theeverygirl.com Check out the full apartment tour on The Everygirl here .
Get the same sofa from West Elm for $999+ , a similar coffee table from Wayfair for $96.99 and a similar rug from Amazon for $59.80+ in many sizes.
ID: 10301146 15. Hang your wall art at eye level for some everyday appreciation. View this image ›
allmodern.com Get it from AllModern for $16.99+ . / Available in four sizes.
ID: 10307885 16. Measure once, twice, even three times to make sure your area rug fits the room. View this image ›
urbanoutfitters.com All the furniture legs should be OFF or ON the rug for a living room.
Get it from Urban Outfitters for $89 .
ID: 10301150 17. Let in lots of light without compromising your color scheme with sheer white and colorful curtain panels . View this image ›
sincerelysarad.com See the full home tour on Sincerely, Sara D. here .
Get two 60”x84” sheer white curtains panels for $4.30 and two 58”x84” sheer pink curtain panels for $4.29 from Amazon.
ID: 10313980 18. Play with the same pattern in different colors to keep things interesting. Test the waters with polka dots . View this image ›
Kate Spade New York If you’re feeling fancy, get the pictured products from Kate Spade New York: Table lamp for $570 and the desk for $3,095 .
If you’re on a budget, get similar products: Gold foil and glitter polka dot lamp from Zazzle for $49.95 and a mid-century two-tone writing desk from Target for $161.49 .
ID: 10312794 19. Paint the interior side of your front door as a colorful touch to an oft-forgotten surface. View this image ›
domino.com Get a quart of satin front-door paint from Amazon for $35 . / Available in 24 colors.
ID: 10307987 20. Style any open shelving for the perfect #shelfie and use it as an opp to display that diptyque candle you’re scared to light. View this image ›
lezoemusings.com Well all know those candles are potent enough that you can get away with not lighting them for a while anyway. See more shelfies on Le Zoe Musings here .
Get diptyque candles from Nordstrom for $32+ .
ID: 10315121 21. Layer plants in pretty vases for a lush look that keeps the eye wandering. View this image ›
potterybarn.com Get them from Pottery Barn for $19.50+ .
ID: 10315363 22. That goes for art , too. Stagger framed pieces against a wall to create the appearance of a robust art collection. View this image ›
urbanoutfitters.com Get the smaller art print from Urban Outfitters for $19+ .
ID: 10315769 23. And finally, add a faux-fur accent for a high-end look that says the person who signed off on it cared zilch about practicality. gilt.com It’ll be our wildly practical little secret.
Get it from Gilt for $24 . / Available in three colors.
ID: 10308247
